ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You do research. If you want to do this, you should.
If you're doing senior project research, it's worth trying to get credit for it.

This course is a valuable opportunity to gain lab experience if you want to guage your interest in research. The experience varies from lab to lab, but I have generally found it to be a rewarding and fun way to work closely with graduate students doing exciting research.

This is a way to fulfill the passion for research that everyone in cognitive science should have while simultaneously earning yourself a credit and a being able to interact with absolutely brilliant professors. I cannot imagine why anyone who was truly interested in cognitive science wouldn't want to take this course. That said, I've done more work for this course than any other directed study or any other class for that matter...still its worth it to take this and drop some other class.
